awd_titl_txt: Electromagnetic Field Enhancement of Membrane Ion Transport Research Initiation Award
awd_abstract_narration: Changing electromagnetic fields affect living                                   organisms but the mechanisms of these effects                                   are unknown.  This proposal is to examine the                                   hypothesis that the fields change the rate of                                   calcium diffusion through the cell membranes                                    by a mechanism involving cyclotron resonance.                                   The approach will be to investigate the                                         transport of calcium ions across artificial                                     membranes with different characteristics,                                       such as porosities and surface charges.  The                                    effects of the direction of the field on the                                    transport will be also examined.  This work                                     may provide important insight into the                                          mechanisms by which electromagnetic fields                                      affect ion transport.  Knowledge of these                                       mechanisms would have applications in both                                      medicine (electrically induced tissue                                           healing, for example) and industry (such as                                     separation technology).
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
